meanings.definition: To fill or feed to excess
meanings.sent1: The cat was glutting on the delicious tuna.
meanings.sent2: After the long hike, they were glutting on the refreshing water.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was glutting on nuts like there was no tomorrow.
meanings.sent4: The river was glutting the valley with its overflowing waters.
meanings.sent5: The greedy child was glutting himself on candy until he felt sick.

meanings.sent1: She was glutting on the attention she received at the party.
meanings.sent2: During the holiday season, people tend to glut on festive treats.
meanings.sent3: The movie star was glutting on compliments from fans.
meanings.sent4: The garden was glutting on the sunlight, blooming beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The bookworm was glutting on novels, losing track of time.
